result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eleazar Camacho-Perez

records.addlTxt: Duplicate letter from defendant regarding speedy trial. (same document as 10-10-22)
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency).
E-mail between RM and WCS.
E-mail correspondence between RM and Attorney Larson.
Duplicate letter from defendant from 10-10-22.
Attorney Larson to the Court requesting proceedings to be suspended.
Letter from Defendant to Court regarding speedy trial.
Review hearing on December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - Criminal Complaint emailed 09-26-2022

Defendant Eleazar Camacho-Perez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ann M. Larson appeared by video for Eleazar Camacho-Perez.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Dr Gail Griffith filed a report on 07-29-2022 which outlines her recommendation that the defendant is not currently competent to proceed in this matter but may regain competency with treatment.

The State does not contest Dr Griffith's findings.  Asks the Court to follow her recommendation and find the defendant not competent.
Attorney Larson argues, asking the Court to find the defendant competent to proceed.
The parties stipulate to Dr Griffith's background and credentials.  
Dr Gail Griffith, Psy.D WI Licensed Psychologist, sworn and testifies for the State.

Based upon Dr Griffith's testimony and her report, the Court finds the defendant is not competent to proceed at this time but may restore competency with inpatient treatment.  Involuntary administration of medications is ordered, if necessary.  
Defendant is ordered into the care and custody of Department of Human Services.  The Department will designate the treatment facility.  
Court finds the defendant is entitled to 100 days credit.  
Court to sign order.  
Review hearing set for 12-13-2022 at 2:30pm.  (Interpreter Susan Rascon confirms this date/time)
Interpreter confirmation
Competency hearing on September 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Interpreter confirmation.  (John Vaughn OR Susan Rascon)
Interpreter, John Vaughn.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody.
John Vaughn is sworn to interpret for the defendant.  (appearing by zoom)
The doctor's report was just filed this morning.  Attorney Larson had spoken to the doctor earlier this week and knew what the findings were.  After speaking with the defendant, this matter will be contested.  Attorney Larson is not ready to proceed and asks for a new hearing date.
The Court tolls any time limits and adjourns the matter to 08-10-22 at 10:00 a.m.
(John Vaughn or Susan Rascon are available to interpret by zoom)
Minutes.
Competency hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Report of Gayle Griffith, Psy.D. WI Licensed Psychologist

records.addlTxt: Interpreter confirmation, John Vaughn.
Email correspondence.
Competency hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Letter requesting competency review
Motion for Bail Modification.
Ann Larson, public defender.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 06-22-22 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Victim 2, on 06-07-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of recklessly endangering safety and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is not to posses any firearms or ammunition, defendant is to have no contact with M.C.P. DOB: 03-26-1992, M.J. H., DOB: 03-21-1995 and no contact with the victims residence, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and defendant must provide an address to the Clerk of Court Office in writing within 48 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-08-2022
